utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So what’s the final head count on my baby shower?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: About twenty, a couple people from work who had something else to do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Also both of your sisters called and neither can make it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! You mean they’re not coming to a social event where there’s no men and there’s no booze?! That’s shocking! I don’t care, as long as my mom’s here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, your mother!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! My mom’s not gonna be here?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, given that we forgot to invite her it would be an awfully big coincidence if she was.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well it wasn’t my fault, Phoebe was in charge of the invitations!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well I don’t, I don’t have a mother so often I forget that other people…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh give it a rest!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So my mother is not coming to my baby shower?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. Neither is mine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, y’know what? Don’t worry, okay? We’ll take care of it. We’ll call her. Just go home and get ready.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Please, make sure she comes. It’s really important to me, I mean it’s my mom!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know. I know, what’s her number?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Go! I have it in my book. Go! Wait a minute! If you’re in charge of the invitations why am I the one who has to call her—Hello Mrs. Green! Hi, it’s Monica Geller.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh, hello Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, umm I know this is last minute, but we’ve decided to throw an impromptu baby shower for Rachel today.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: I know, my daughter’s told me about it when they received their impromptu invitations a month ago.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry. I’m-I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: For what dear? For not inviting me or lying about it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, my ass is sweating! Please! Please! Can you come? It’s today at four.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Well all right. I’ll see you at four.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Isn’t it at three?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Joe! You wanna shoot some hoops?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no, I can’t go. I’m practicing; I got an audition to be the host of a new game show.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh cool!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s great.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, and if I get it by day I’ll Dr. Drake Remoray, but by night I’ll be Joey Trrrribbiani!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’ll be perfect for this! That’s already your name!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But the audition’s in a couple hours and I don’t even understand the game.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well do you want some help?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh really? That’d be great! You guys can be the contestants!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Awesome!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I guess we can lose to junior high girls some other time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Let’s play Bamboozled!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bamboozled?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, isn’t that a cool name?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right. Uhh, okay. Our first contestant is Ross Geller. Why don’t you tell us a little something about you Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well uh, I-I’m a paleontologist. Umm, I-I live in New York. I have a son Ben. Uh, hi Ben! And uh…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I said a little bit Ross. Now, how about you Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well Joey, I’m a headhunter. I hook up out of work Soviet scientists with rogue third-world nations. Hi Rasputin!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Excellent! Let’s play Bamboozled! Chandler, you’ll go first. What is the capital of Columbia?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bogota.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s Ba-go-ta, but close enough. Now, you can either pass your turn to Ross or pick a Wicked Wango card.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What does a Wicked Wango card do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I should know that. Let’s see, just one moment please. Umm, here we are, a Wicked Wango card determines whether you go higher or lower.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Higher or lower than what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can you believe how lame this is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t believe contestants are allowed to talk to each other.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I told the stripper to be here at five. That’s good right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You ordered a stripper for the shower?! That is totally inappropriate!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? He’s gonna be dressed as a baby! Oh hi Mrs. Green!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m so glad you could make it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, thank you so much. And again, we’re so sorry. We could not feel worse about it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Try. There’s my little girl.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s still mad.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I know. Isn’t it great? One less person we have to make small talk with.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, Sandra’s mad at you too. It-it doesn’t bother you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No look, we’ve apologized twice! I can’t do anymore than that. I know you hate it when people are mad at you but you just have to be okay with it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. I can do that. I gotta go powder my ass.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Look at that face! Just like when you were in high school! If I didn’t know better I’d say you were a cheerleader in trouble. Come on, let’s get some tea.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh my look at that. Only three weeks to go, now have you picked your nanny yet? Now I don’t want you to use your housekeeper ‘cause it would just split her focus.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh well actually gonna use a nanny and uh, I don’t even have a housekeeper.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: It’s like you’re a cave person. Rachel, you must get a nanny. You don’t know how overwhelming this is going to be. I mean when you were a baby I had full time help, I had Mrs. Kay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mrs. Kay! Oh yeah, she was sweet. She taught me Spanish. I actually think I remember some of it, tu madre es loca.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Such a sweet woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, however great she was I just can’t afford that.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: I just had the greatest idea! I’m gonna come live with you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wh-wh-what? What?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so happy I’m gonna do this for my little girl. Aw, look at you. You have tears in your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes. Yes I do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right Ross you’re in the lead, would you like to take another question or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The wheel has not been my friend tonight Joey. Uh, I’ll take another question.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, this is gonna be tough. Hold your breath.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s okay, I’m ready.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No dude, you gotta hold your breath until you’re ready to answer the question.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is ridiculous, he’s not gonna hold his breath…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, what do you have a fear of if you suffer from this phobia, Tris…Holy cow, that’s a big word. Trisc… Seriously look at this thing. Chandler, how do you say that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let me see that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This one right here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Triscadecaphobia.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The fear of Triscuts!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No, fear of the number 13.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fear of Triscuts?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s possible, they have really sharp edges.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right Chandler, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute, I-I believe I’m entitled to use my Angel Pass for a free turn?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This game makes no sense!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what? You’re just upset because you’re losing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh come on Ross, I think we’re all losers here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right. Chandler, you can either spin the wheel or pick a Google card.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let me think. Let me think—Oh! I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You-you must choose Mr. Bing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Either, it makes no difference.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Choose, you jackass!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll take a card.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, you picked the Gimmie card! You get all of Ross’s points!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This game is kinda fun.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You don’t think it’s a little crazy that you get all my points just ‘cause you…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t think the contestants are supposed to speak to each other.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why did you invite my mother?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She wants to move in with me and Ross to help take care of the baby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: For how long?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eight weeks. I mean I love my mother, but my God, a long lunch with her is taxing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I personally would be honored if she wanted to live with me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She can’t hear you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? You guys, come on! What am I going to do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if you don’t want your mother to move in with you, just tell her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re right. You’re right. I mean I’m about to have a baby, I can tell my mother that I don’t want her to just be sleeping on my couch! Oh my God! She’s gonna want to sleep in my bed with me. This cannot happen!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right. That is right, you go over there and tell her you don’t want her to live with you. Do not take no for an answer!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is great! Now she’s gonna be mad at Rachel! Y’know what? And I’m just gonna swoop in there and be like the daughter she never had.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I have new respect for Chandler. All right everybody! It’s time to open the presents!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes! Yes! And I think that the first gift that Rachel opens should be from the grandmother of the baby, because you’re the most important person in this room. And in the world!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Well uh, I don’t have a gift because I wasn’t invited until the last minute, but thank you so much for bringing that to everyone’s attention.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How about you less important people, let’s open your presents!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mom that’s okay that you didn’t get you a gift!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Well, I kinda did. Me. Eight weeks of me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Okay, see mom, the truth is I can do this on my own.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Sweetheart I know you’re gonna be terrific mom, I just think you need a little help, especially at the beginning.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But mom, I really know what I’m doing. I can handle this.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Really? Remember Twinkles?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He was a hamster! I am not going to vacuum up my baby!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, come on Rach it’s present time! Y’know you’re the glue that’s holding this whole party together. It’s kinda falling apart here.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh look.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, this is from your friend at work.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my gosh! Oh wow! Oh, I know what this is! Wait a minute. That can’t be right. Is that a beer bong for a baby?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Darling, that’s a breast pump!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did I say I was done guessing? Okay, thank you for that. Oh wow! What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It’s a diaper genie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it dispenses clean diapers!

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: No! It’s where you put the dirty ones!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well that’s gross, why don’t you just take it outside and throw it in a dumpster?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh you’re gonna do that ten times a day?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! It goes ten times a day! What are we feeding this baby?! Indian food?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: No dear, that’s what babies do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, listen to your mother. She is very smart.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Plus, what are you planning on doing with the baby while you’re trotting out to the garbage ten times a day?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know, I’d leave it on the changing table? What?! What’d I do? What’d I do?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: You can’t leave a baby alone!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come——Of course I know that. I mean of course you never leave a baby alone! I mean who would—she wouldn’t be safe as she would be with me, the baby dummy. Oh God, okay. Y’know what? I think opening the presents right now is a little overwhelming right now. So I think umm, I’m just gonna maybe open them a little bit later, but thank you all for coming. And for these beautiful gifts, and this basket is beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It’s actually a bassinet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay mommy, don’t ever leave me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: In what John Houston film would you hear this line, "Badges? We don’t need no stinkin’ badges!"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Treasure of the Sierra Madre!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Correct! There’s a possible backwards bonus!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Madre Sierra the of Treasure!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’d like to go up the ladder of chance to the golden mud hut please.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wise choice, how many rungs?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Six!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That noise can only me one thing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hungry monkey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hungry monkey! Haaa! I’d like a Wicked Wango card!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, it’s an audio question, name this television theme song.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Oh! Oh my God! Okay, I know this, give me-give me a second!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tell it to the Time Turtle!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Shut up! I Dream of Genie!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! Yes, you’re back in the lead!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’d like to spin the wheel!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh come on!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! All right! Uh, umm, Super-Speedy Speed round!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is there a hopping bonus?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Of course!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who invented bifocals?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ben Franklin.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Correct! Which monarch has ruled Great Britain the longest?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Queen Victoria.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Correct again! But, you forgot to switch legs between questions, so no hopping bonus!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Noooo!!! Every time!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now, over to Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’d like a Google Card.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! No! Google!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! Congratulations Ross, because Chandler, you’ve been Bamboozled!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nooo!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is the best game ever!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So umm, you’re gonna stay with me as long as I need you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Of course I am!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh mom, I swear I’m not an idiot. I’ve read all kinds of books on pregnancy and giving birth, but I-I just didn’t think to read the part about what to do when the baby comes. And-and then guess what? The baby’s coming and I don’t know what to do. Oh, can I throw up in my diaper genie?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: No. Sweetie, you’re gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait-wait where are you going? Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: I’m going to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Now don’t worry! Everything’s gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It is going to be okay! It was worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Why are you all red and sweaty?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just Bamboozled Chandler! Which is not uh sexual thing. That was a quick shower.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not if you were here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! It looks like we got a lot of good stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh we did, but my mom got us the greatest gift of all.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A Play-Dough Barber Shop?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. She’s going to live with us for eight weeks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! She’s gonna help us take care of the baby! Woo-hoo.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What—You’re not serious. I mean she’s a very nice woman, but there is no way we can take eight weeks of her. She’ll drive us totally crazy.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Hi Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi roomie!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hey Joey, hi! I’m Ray; I’m the producer of the show.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s a pleasure to meet you Ray.

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: And this is Duncan and Erin, they’re gonna help us out with the audition. So uh, let’s get the camera rolling.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rightie-O Ray!

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Whenever you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello, I’m Joey Tribbiani! Let’s play Bamboozled! Erin, you get the first question! In hockey, who is known as The Great One?

utterance.speaker: Erin
utterance.content: Wayne Gretzky.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Correct! Now, would you like to pick a Wicked Wango card or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Uh Joey, didn’t your agents give you the revised rules? We’ve eliminated all of that. No wheel, no cards.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What—Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Uh well, the game was too complicated and research showed people didn’t follow it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well what’s complicated? You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey; you yank his tail and boom! You’re in Paradise Pond!

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Yeah all that’s gone. It’s basically just a simple question and answer game now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well what’s fun about that? You expect me to be the host of a boring game that’s just people standing around answering questions?

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Well, there’ll be women in bikinis holding up the scores.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Let’s play Bamboozled!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: …and all those dinosaur nick-knacks you have Ross, I thought they might be more at home in the garage.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well we…we don’t have a garage.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Did I say garage? I meant garbage.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what? Maybe, Mrs. Green, it’s not absolutely vital that you live with us.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Well Rachel needs help with the baby.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I do. I really do. I don’t know anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m-I’m sure that’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no? Pheebs? Monica? Do I know anything about babies?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, not a thing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s frightening.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well uh, y’know what? Even if she doesn’t know anything, I do! I have a son. And his mother and I didn’t live together, and whenever he was with me I took care of him all the time, by myself.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: That’s true. You do have another child.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: With another woman. Have you no control Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s a different issue. Uh, the point is, when the baby comes I will be there to…to feed her and bathe her and change her. And more than that I want to do all those things.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Well then you really don’t need me to live with you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes! Yes, you’re gonna be so missed.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: You’re gonna be a great father.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well you’re gonna be a wonderful grandma.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello?! I still don’t know what the hell I’m doing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come on, every first time mother feels that way. You’ll—you’re gonna pick it up. Hey! You will! Uh look, y’know when you first came to the city? You were this spoiled helpless little girl who-who still used daddy’s credit card. Do you remember?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I hope you’re going somewhere with this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look at you! What—You’re-you’re this big executive! You are much more capable than you give yourself credit for. I-I have no doubt you’re gonna be an incredible mother.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m telling you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: All right you two, I’m gonna get going.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no sweetheart, you stay put. I’ll let myself out. It’s like I’m not here, which I almost wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re still so funny. You’re so funny. What do I do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nothing! You have apologized to her like a million times and she’s been nothing but terrible to you. And don’t forget you just threw her daughter a lovely, albeit slightly boring, shower, and she hasn’t even thanked you for it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know what? You’re-you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I mean if you want to say anything to her, I’d tell her off.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! I will! Mrs. Green? Mrs. Green! It is rude to leave a party without saying good-bye to the host! Yeah, and-and also when someone apologizes to you the decent thing to do is to accept it! Now what I did to you, it wasn’t on purpose! But what you’re during to me now is just plain spiteful!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Green
utterance.content: Spiteful?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right! Maybe it’s time you took a good hard look at a mirror young lady…old lady…lady!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wrap it up, wrap it up, wrap it up…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So whenever you’re ready to apologize to me, I will forgive you. Good day! I can’t feel my legs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You were fantastic! I’m so proud of you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah? I’m proud of me too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You should be!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah could-could-could you get me something to drink?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You got it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Mrs. Green! Okay I’m really sorry!! I’m apologizing for the— Okay, I bit my tongue, but I’m still really sorry!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! I’m ready.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, I’ve done my studying and I really know my stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right then. Rachel Green! Let’s play Bamboozled! How do you test the temperature of the baby’s bath water?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, put your elbow in it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excellent! How do you put a baby down for a nap?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s correct! This is an audio question, what do you do when the baby makes this sound?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Check if it’s wet, check if it’s hungry, burp it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excellent! Excellent, now-now do you want another question or a Wicked Wango card?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: A card! A card! I pick a card!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry you’ve been Bamboozled! You’re gonna be a terrible mother! I’ve lost sight of why we’re doing this!
